      • EditTaskActivityTest

    • Method Detail

      • getActivityClass

        protected java.lang.Class<EditTaskActivity> getActivityClass()
        Gets the Activity that this intent test will test. This should always return the class corresponding to the type parameter of the AbstractIntentTest.
        Returns:
        Activity class being tested

      • shouldStartAutomatically

        protected boolean shouldStartAutomatically()
        Template method to determine whether the tested activity should start before running each test or not.
        Returns:
        true to start before each test; false to not start

      • getInitialSessionUser

        @Nullable
protected User getInitialSessionUser()
        Template method to determine the initial session user that will be used to create the MockSession. This user will be the session user for the test activity unless and until the activity or test changes the session user. Returning null will create a logged-out MockSession. The session user will be reset before each test. Note that this method should always be called after createMockData for each test, so it can return a User that was created there.
        Returns:
        User to use as session user

      • createMockData

        protected void createMockData(CachingClient<ca.ualberta.cs.wrkify.MockRemoteClient> client)
        Template method that will be called during MockRemoteClient initialization for each test. The test can use this method to create test data that will be the same for each test (likely by calling client.create(...)). Note that the client is recreated for each test, so the results of this method applied to an empty client should always constitute the entire state of the client at the start of each test.
        Parameters:
        client - current MockRemoteClient

      • testNewTask

        public void testNewTask()
        Create a new task. Should: show empty fields not show a delete option allow editing title, description return a task with the new values

      • testNewTaskWithChecklist

        public void testNewTaskWithChecklist()
        Create a new task with a checklist. Should: allow creating a checklist allow adding items to the checklist allow editing items in the checklist allow removing items from the checklist hide the checklist if it has no items save the checklist to the task

      • testEditExistingTask

        public void testEditExistingTask()
        Edit an existing task. Should: display the current task details allow editing the task details return the edited task

      • testDeleteTask

        public void testDeleteTask()
        Delete a task. Should: show the delete option return RESULT_TASK_DELETED

      • testNewTaskInvalidTitle

        public void testNewTaskInvalidTitle()
        Create a task with no title. Should: fail

      • testEditTaskInvalidTitle

        public void testEditTaskInvalidTitle()
        Save an edited task with no title. Should: fail

      • testEditTaskWithChecklist

        public void testEditTaskWithChecklist()
        Edit a task with a checklist. Should: show the existing checklist allow adding an item allow deleting an item allow editing an item

      • setup

        public final void setup()
        Common intent test setup. Sets mock objects for the global session and client, and initializes them as specified by createMockData() and getInitialSessionUser(). The activity will also be started automatically here if shouldStartAutomatically() returns true. Specific intent tests should override the aformentioned template methods, not this method.

      • getClient

        @NonNull
public final CachingClient<ca.ualberta.cs.wrkify.MockRemoteClient> getClient()
        Gets the active session client.
        Returns:
        active client

        Returns:

public final ca.ualberta.cs.wrkify.MockSession getSession()

        Returns:
        active session
